text: Haley Reeves Barbour (born October 22, 1947) is an American politician. He was the governor of Mississippi from 2004 to 2012. He was mentioned as a possible candidate for President of the United States in the 2012. In April 2011, Barbour said he will not run for president. ==Early years== Barbour was born in Yazoo City, Mississippi, where he was raised as the youngest of three sons of Grace LeFlore (n√©e Johnson) and Jeptha Fowlkes Barbour, Jr. Haley's father, a lawyer, died when Barbour was two years old. Barbour's father who was a Circuit Judge had an inmate to assist him when Judge Barbour became ill. Leon Turner, who was given a posthumous pardon by Barbour in the closing days of his administration, had helped to raise him. ==References== ==Other websites== * Haley Barbour's official website * Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:Businesspeople from Mississippi Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:People from Yazoo City, Mississippi Category:Governors of Mississippi Category:21st-century American politicians
title: Haley Barbour
